hr.fer.oop.lab3.welcomepack

Interface SimpleFootballPlayerCollection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleFootballPlayerCollectionImpl

    public interface SimpleFootballPlayerCollection
    A specification of a simple data structure in which players are stored. Implementation of this interface has (along with variables you find necessary - e.g., int size) an array.
    Author:
    OOP

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean add(FootballPlayer player)
      Adds a player in a collection if he has not been previously added and if there is a space available for a player within a collection.
      int calculateEmotionSum()
      Calculates the sum of emotions from all players within a collection.
      int calculateSkillSum()
      Calculates the sum of skills from all players within a collection.
      void clear()
      Clears all players from a collection.
      boolean contains(FootballPlayer player)
      Checks whether a collection contains a player.
      int getMaxSize()
      Maximum number of players who can be stored in a collection, e.g., if a collection is used to store starting eleven then this method should return 11;
      FootballPlayer[] getPlayers()
      Method used to get the underlying array in which players are actually stored.
      int size()
      Returns the number of players currently stored in a collection.

    • Method Detail

      • size

        int size()
        Returns the number of players currently stored in a collection.
        Returns:
        current number of players within a collection.

      • contains

        boolean contains(FootballPlayer player)
        Checks whether a collection contains a player.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        true if a collection contains a player, false otherwise.

      • add

        boolean add(FootballPlayer player)
        Adds a player in a collection if he has not been previously added and if there is a space available for a player within a collection.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        true if a player is added, false otherwise.

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears all players from a collection.

      • getMaxSize

        int getMaxSize()
        Maximum number of players who can be stored in a collection, e.g., if a collection is used to store starting eleven then this method should return 11;
        Returns:
        maximum number of players - a collection's capacity.

      • calculateEmotionSum

        int calculateEmotionSum()
        Calculates the sum of emotions from all players within a collection.
        Returns:
        the sum of emotions.

      • calculateSkillSum

        int calculateSkillSum()
        Calculates the sum of skills from all players within a collection.
        Returns:
        the sum of emotions.

      • getPlayers

        FootballPlayer[] getPlayers()
        Method used to get the underlying array in which players are actually stored.
        Returns:
        an array.
